title: Photostat, "Proposed Hostelry: Center for American Visitors to the Paris Exposition, 1925", 1923
medium: Photostat and black ink on paper
signed: Printed lower right in black ink: DRESSEE PAR LA DELEGATION/ DU GROUPE DES ARCHITECTES/ MODERNES/ HECTOR GUIMARD/ HENRI SAUVAGE/ VICE PRESIDENTS DU GROUPE/ LOUIS BRACHET/JOACHIM RICHARD ET/ GEORGES ROEHRICH/ LOUIS PIERRE SEZILLE. ARCHITECTES
inscribed:
Printed at top in black ink: GROUPE DES ARCHITECTES MODERNES
Printed at bottom left in black ink: HOTEL DE VOYAGEURS/ MAISON AMERICAINE/ IMMEUBLES DE RAPPORT/ CONSTRUCTIONS DEFINITIVES/ POUR LOGER LES VISITEURS/ DE L'EXPOSITION DES ARTS/ DECORATIFS DE 1925/ REZ DE CHAUSSEE
description: Architectural plan for the lodging of American visitors to the Paris Exposition of Decorative Arts. Guimard has noted scale throughout the drawing.
